snippet: The Red Sox, losers of 91 games for the first time since 1966, traveled to New York this week for what could be the final three games that Bobby Valentine manages in Major League Baseball.
abstract: Bill Pennington On Baseball column; Boston Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine, having come back to the major leagues after ten years away and leading the team to 91 losses in one season, may no longer have a career in American baseball.
lead_paragraph: The Red Sox, losers of 91 games for the first time since 1966, traveled to New York this week for what could be the final three games that Bobby Valentine manages in Major League Baseball.

headline.seo: Bobby Valentine of Red Sox Ending a Lost Season
headline.main: A Lost, and Possibly Last, Season for Valentine
headline.print_headline: For Valentine, a Lost, and Possibly Last, Season
